location_of_the_samples_and_sections: Kunga Island, Queen Charlotte Islands (QCI), and Inuyama (INY), Japan (Page 6)
lithology: Sandstone, siltstone, shale, and limestone with thin tuffs and abundant calcareous concretions (Page 2)
number_of_species_and_genera_found: Nearly 20 genera and over 130 Rhaetian species disappeared at the end of the Triassic (Page 777)
